Plot: In my opinion one of the finest novels of our time. - Graham Greene Shusaku Endo is Japan's foremost novelist, and Silence is generally regarded to be his masterpiece. In a perfect fusion of treatment and theme, this powerful novel tells the story of a seventeenth-century Portuguese priest in Japan at the height of the fearful persecution of the small Christian community.
Characters: Sebastião Rodrigues, Cristóvão Ferreira, Kichijiro, Tokugawa Inoue
